bioghist.p: Jane Trescott Flory was born in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania in 1917. She was educated at the Philadelphia Museum School of Industrial Art (now Philadelphia College of Art), receiving her degree in 1939. She began working as a freelance writer and illustrator of children’s books soon after college, and married artist and college instructor Arthur Leroy Flory in 1941. Flory’s first children’s book, Snooty, the Pig Who Was Proud, was published in 1944 and her last, The Great Bamboozlement, was published in 1982. In addition to her writing, Flory served as director of the evening division of the Philadelphia College of Art in Philadelphia from 1958-1974.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of manuscripts, illustrations, and notes of Jane Flory. Documentation is present for a number of Flory's books, including The Liberation of Clementine Tipton, We'll Have a Friend for Lunch, Ramshackle Roost, The Unexpected Grandchildren, The Faraway Dream, It Was a Pretty Good Year, and The Golden Venture. Materials include manuscript drafts, notes and sketches, galley proofs, and correspondence with editors. The collection also includes a handwritten and illustrated manuscript of This Is Farmer John, which was never published, and several notebooks containing story outlines, manuscript drafts of stories, and notes on character development and changes to story lines.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
